title: What is a DDoS attack?
summary: An overview of distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attacks, explaining how attackers flood servers with fake traffic using compromised systems.

title: API Gateways: Front Door for Microservices
summary: Discover how API Gateways serve as a unified entry point in distributed systems, simplifying client requests and handling backend orchestration.

title: Load Balancers: Optimizing Traffic for Distributed Systems
summary: Uncover how load balancing distributes traffic across servers and resources to boost efficiency, reduce latency, and ensure fault tolerance.

title: Reverse Proxies: Nginx as the Hidden Guardian
summary: Delve into reverse proxies like Nginx, which shield backend servers by intercepting and routing client requests, providing abstraction.

title: Evolution of HTTP: From 1.0 to HTTP/2
summary: Trace the journey of HTTP protocols from early versions to modern advancements, highlighting key improvements in performance, security, efficiency.

title: Redis Pub/Sub: Real-Time Messaging Simplified
summary: Explore Redis Pub/Sub as a decoupled messaging pattern for instant communication—like a radio broadcast—ideal for chat apps and live updates.

title: WebSockets and Socket.IO: Real-Time Web Revolution
summary: Dive into WebSockets for persistent, bidirectional client-server communication, enhanced by Socket.IO's abstractions for easier real-time features.
